conclusion: Understand that particles meet when they have the same position at the same time.
Both particles start at the origin (0,0).
Particle A accelerates to 2v₀ at t = t₀, then decelerates to 0 at t = 3t₀.
Particle B accelerates more slowly, reaching v₀ at t = 4t₀, then decelerates to 0 at t = 6t₀.
Calculate position of particle A from 0 to t₀: Area of triangle = ½ × t₀ × 2v₀ = v₀t₀.
Calculate position of particle A from t₀ to 3t₀: Area of triangle = ½ × 2t₀ × 2v₀ = 2v₀t₀.
Total distance traveled by A = v₀t₀ + 2v₀t₀ = 3v₀t₀.
Calculate position of particle B from 0 to 4t₀: Area of triangle = ½ × 4t₀ × v₀ = 2v₀t₀.
Calculate position of particle B from 4t₀ to 6t₀: Area of triangle = ½ × 2t₀ × v₀ = v₀t₀.
Total distance traveled by B = 2v₀t₀ + v₀t₀ = 3v₀t₀.
Particle A stops at t = 3t₀ after traveling 3v₀t₀ distance.
Particle B stops at t = 6t₀ after traveling 3v₀t₀ distance.
Particles A and B meet at t = 6t₀, when B finally catches up to A's position.
The particles A and B meet at time t = 6t₀.
